description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category
Sales

Job Details

About Salesforce

We're Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI Data CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too - driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good - you've come to the right place.

About Us:

We're Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI Data CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too - driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good- you've come to the right place.

Responsibilities:
• Develop joint business plans with System Integrators and deliver against joint targets.
• Have a material impact on net new,incremental business development and Annual Contract Value (ACV) sales.
• Influence the partner ecosystem to create a dedicated Salesforce practice that enables partners to drive digital transformation for their clients.
• Design new and exciting offerings to help partners show differentiation and address customers' toughest digital challenges.
• Collaborate closely with internal cross-functional stakeholders to leverage sales enablement, global partner enablement, services, and customer success teams to align messaging, methodology, and best practices.

Expectations and Tasks:
• Lead the formulation and execution of alliance strategies and go-to-market (GTM) plans
• Actively pursue new leads and opportunities outside the Salesforce ecosystem for business growth
• Drive revenue-generating programs and initiatives to support channel organizations and stakeholders
• Advocate for Salesforce's value proposition within partner organizations
• Reciprocally champion the partner's value within Salesforce and affiliated companies
• Collaborate seamlessly with sales, alliances, marketing, and operations teams
• Keep up to date of industry trends and policies to offer guidance and insights for partner offerings
• Introduce partner sales plays, offerings, and industry assets/solutions to Partner Sales driving new ACV
• Explore avenues for commercializing industry solutions through joint development with partners
• Identify target accounts and work closely with sales and partner leadership to expand business
• Implement and maintain pipelines and dashboards for clear communication of program effectiveness
• Actively pursue new leads beyond Salesforce ecosystem for broader market presence
• Implement strategies for "land and expand" to maximize growth potential
• Facilitate regular communication and coordination between partners and Salesforce stakeholders
• Ensure effective and timely dissemination of Salesforce's ecosystem strategy and execution results both internally and externally

Top Qualifications:
• Passion for sales and working with large complex partnerships
• Highly effective at working with both SI and VAR partners.
• Exceptional track record of leveraging a partner ecosystem to build and close deals, collaborating across all levels of the organization.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to execute in a rapidly growing and changing environment.
• Demonstrable history of closing significant software licensing deals and achieving quota.
• Experience in building strategic offerings and new paths to revenue with SI and VAR partners.

Work Experience:
• 7-10 years of experience in alliance, channel sales or channel management roles.
• Concentration on supporting multiple partner types including Global System Integrators (GSI), as well as boutique and regional System Integrators (SI).

Note: This is not an exhaustive list of duties or responsibilities. Additional duties may be assigned as needed.

If you are a highly motivated and experienced sales professional with a passion for working with partners, driving revenue, and achieving customer and partner success, we encourage you to apply for the position of Partner Alliance Manager at Salesforce.

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this .

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at and explore our company benefits at .

is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with.

Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For New York-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $170,660 to $228,340.For Colorado-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $155,120 to $207,550.For Washington-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $170,660 to $228,340.For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $170,660 to $228,349.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.
